amendment.description: Amendment requires that environmental concerns be taken into account when OPIC is considering assistance for projects that are likely to have a significant adverse environmental impact.
amendment.purpose: Amendment no. 1 printed in the Congressional Record to prohibit a vote on projects that may have adverse environmental impacts unless assessments have been made available to the public for a 60 day comment period and require that OPIC meet with at least one representative of individuals who have concerns about the project's environmental impact.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Gejdenson amendment (A002) Agreed to by voice vote.
